channel.title: L4D 2
channel.description:
Discuss.
[url]https://www.maximumpc.com/article/news/e3_2009_left_4_dead_2_announced_4_new_survivors_5_new_campaigns[/url]
What the hell is the "Savannah Campaign" going to be about? Says it takes place before the infection. I'm sure it will tie into the "stronger narrative thread to connect the campaigns", but what will the player actually do if they aren't killing zombies?

item.title: L4D 2
item.dc:creator: Deimos
item.description:
Arkanti:

Or the Penumbra series available on Steam, most people seem to find it scary but I just found it very atmospheric like other “scary” games.

It’s a very good game though, and it utilises the atmosphere well to tell the story. If anyone liked the recently released Research and Development mod, they’d love these games.

Yeah just finished the first one, the ending of it scared the shit out of me lol

Read full topic

item.title: L4D 2
item.dc:creator: Arkanti
item.description:
Exoskeletor:

guys if anyone wants a scary game he should really, REALLY give a try to clive barker’s undying, and dont judge it from the beggining, it gets better and better

Or the Penumbra series available on Steam, most people seem to find it scary but I just found it very atmospheric like other “scary” games.

It’s a very good game though, and it utilises the atmosphere well to tell the story. If anyone liked the recently released Research and Development mod, they’d love these games.

item.title: L4D 2
item.dc:creator: Carbon14
item.description:
Soup:

Carbon14, that’s absolute rubbish. For a start, the characters in L4D1 aren’t exactly dark and gritty themselves. I mean, Francis saying he hates everything? Zoey talking about movies, and how the zombies aren’t canon? Sure, they have their serious moment, plenty of them. But then, I imagine the characters in L4D2 will.

I don’t see how they’re going for ‘some sort of humorous “har har, retarded southern hick zombie” feel’. Haven’t seen any evidence of that in the gameplay, or the trailers.

The new special infected look terrifying, to be frank, just as scary as the ones in L4D1. They sure as hell don’t look stupid.

Seems to me like you’re just looking for something to bitch about because they didn’t announce EP3, since you didn’t actually say anything worth while, you just spouted angry opinion based on nothing.

Not exactly nothing. From the previews I can see the charger has a silly looking gimpy arm, I can see coach looks like he couldn’t outrun a turtle, I can see Ellis is portrayed as a dimwit happy go lucky type, I can hear the farcical sounding horde music. This however is my own opinion and other people evidently like those things. Definitely just not my type of game, L4D had a great style, L4D2 just looks like a poorly thought out funny mod at the moment from my point of view. Don’t even get me started on magical burning bullets

Read full topic

item.title: L4D 2
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
Dias:

I should give The Path a try, because I found Doom 3, Dead Space and FEAR almost laughable in their attempts to be scary.

Watch out tho, it’s not the kind of horror everybody’s used to. I’d describe it as psychological horror. It’s at the same time beautiful and disturbing. But you’ll see for yourself if you try it.

Read full topic

item.title: L4D 2

item.description:
Personally games you stated above were never scary to me. Things jumping into my face never really made me jump. But The Path scared the shit out of me tho.

item.title: L4D 2
item.dc:creator: Fungus
item.description:
Left 4 Dead was never ‘scary’, IMO. Games like Doom 3, Dead Space, various FEARS were scary. Left 4 Dead was and is a good game to be shure, mowing down waves of zombies with relentless machine gun fire, but it never seemed to be aimed at scaring players.

Read full topic

item.title: L4D 2
item.dc:creator: Soup
item.description:
Carbon14, that’s absolute rubbish. For a start, the characters in L4D1 aren’t exactly dark and gritty themselves. I mean, Francis saying he hates everything? Zoey talking about movies, and how the zombies aren’t canon? Sure, they have their serious moment, plenty of them. But then, I imagine the characters in L4D2 will.

I don’t see how they’re going for ‘some sort of humorous “har har, retarded southern hick zombie” feel’. Haven’t seen any evidence of that in the gameplay, or the trailers.

The new special infected look terrifying, to be frank, just as scary as the ones in L4D1. They sure as hell don’t look stupid.

Seems to me like you’re just looking for something to bitch about because they didn’t announce EP3, since you didn’t actually say anything worth while, you just spouted angry opinion based on nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: L4D 2
item.dc:creator: Carbon14
item.description:
Seriously what are valve doing, L4D1 is dark and gritty, film grain etc. It was even darker in it’s beta stages. Now we have supremely goofy characters and new special infected that look like they came from a special school. Are they actually trying to go for some sort of humorous “har har, retarded southern hick zombie” feel? All the original infected looked at least somewhat menacing, even the boomer was in proportion for an immensely fat ball of lard and the tank appeared to be like some sort of steroid crazed muscle man. Now we have some zombie that looks like a thalidomide baby gone wrong and some albeit disgusting, but retarded looking ET lookalike.

I’m seriously pretty disappointed, TF2 is great, it’s humor is awesome, Portal is great, and it’s humor is awesome, L4D is great, and it’s slightly darker humor is awesome. This, on the other hand fails, imho. Lets hope they don’t fuck up EP3 trying to include comedic turrets and robots from aperture science as well.

Read full topic

item.title: L4D 2
item.dc:creator: sudpuzzer
item.description:
raw_bean:

Whatever.

That was a tad anti-climactic. But awesome nonetheless.

I don’t see what’s wrong with Left 4 Dead 2. Obviously, Valve felt they left something out of the first one, and wanted to throw some new stuff into another installment. They must be adding quite alot for it to warrant it’s own title and not just an update…

Read full topic

item.title: L4D 2
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
Dias:

The AK47 handles exactly like the M4 from L4D1.

Yes, but is there special ammo that can set zombies on FIRE?!
No? Then Left 4 Dead 2 is worth every penny in that $50 price tag!
First Pong bringing gaming to the masses, then Mario 64 brining gaming to the 3rd Dimension, and now Left 4 Dead 2’s innovative ammo that sets zombies on fire. It’s truly the next step in gaming evolution. You should be happy to be alive in this magical time in gaming history. All 40,000+ of you.

Is anyone else tired of this joke yet? Well too bad! Because I’m going to beat this dead horse until I experience this marvelous gaming innovation myself!!

Read full topic

item.title: L4D 2
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
ducis:

if you where to compare a source2007 screenshot to a crysis screenshot or a UT3 screenshot you would find that the source engine is far from outdated but infact it is top of the line.

episode 2:

Crysis:

Unreal Tournament 3:

which one looks the best?

for much of the naysayers its just valve’s attention to optimization that turns people off. But if you make a level in source like you would make one in crysis, you could make it look just as good or better, with crysis’s only advantage being DX10.

lol fail.

Read full topic
